name: Lupus-TR-3
scenarioDescription:
The Lupus-TR-3 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Lupus-TR-3 is a star with 0.87 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.82 times its radius. It is located 6523.12 light years away from the solar system.

Lupus-TR-3 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Lupus-TR-3 system

Lupus-TR-3 b

Lupus-TR-3 b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory using the Transit method. The mass of Lupus-TR-3 b is 257.431 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Lupus-TR-3 b is 9.976 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Lupus-TR-3 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, Lupus-TR-3 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Lupus-TR-3, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Multiple Observatories.
